titlestmt.titleproper: Biographical sketches of the Mifflin and Ross families 1864
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012

did.unittitle: Biographical sketches of the Mifflin and Ross families

scopecontent.p: Biographical sketches, 1864, of some of the ancestors of Elizabeth Mifflin, including members of the Mifflin and Ross families. The volume focuses primarily on John Ross of Philadelphia, a merchant who had been authorized by the Committee of Commerce to procure supplies for the use of the Continental Army during the American Revolution. The debt he contracted in performing the service brought about a correspondence with Benjamin Franklin which is copied here together with a letter of Benjamin Franklin to John Jay (copy). Published in part by Elizabeth Mifflin in "The Pennsylvania Magazine" v. 23, pp. 77-85.

accessrestrict.p: Access to this collection is restricted; please contact the holding institution for details.
